notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to execute dynamic scripts in the context of the application, which could allow cross-site scripting attacks.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS-CERT website in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target this vulnerability.
notes.title: Exploitability

product.name: Smart Telecontrol Unit TCG: Versions 5.0.27 5.1.19 6.0.16 and prior;
IEC104 Security Proxy: Version 2.2.10 and prior
Telecontrol Gateway VM: Versions 4.2.21 5.0.27 5.1.19 6.0.16 and prior;
Telecontrol Gateway XS-MU: Versions 4.2.21 5.0.27 5.1.19 6.0.16 and prior;

branches.name: PSI GridConnect GmbH (formerly PSI Nentec GmbH)

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: The web application browser interprets input as active HTML, JavaScript, or VBScript, which could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.CVE-2019-6528 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:L/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: PSI recommends users of affected devices update their devices to a version where this vulnerability is patched.

To obtain the update, contact PSI GridConnect via email at: support@psigridconnect.com. A fix for the vulnerability is available in the following software releases: 5.1.20; 6.0.17,IEC104 Security Proxy Version 2.2.11; The following software releases are no longer supported: 4.2.x, and 5.0.x
PSI recommends deactivating the webserver via CLI since the web interface is not essential to the configuration of the device.
